awd_titl_txt: Building an Integrated Identification, Engagement and Assessment Infrastructure for STEM Enrichment Programs at Hunter College
org_div_long_name: Div. of Equity for Excellence in STEM

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK

por.por_cntn:
Funding from this project was used in various ways as Hunter worked to build a culture of undergraduate research.  Hunter’s I-cubed project transformed the way STEM enrichment programs were made available to students at Hunter and facilitated the work of faculty in educating students in these programs and sharing information and opportunities across programs.  Results and finding from this project are currently in press (see manuscript attached). The project:

a)     identified students for recruitment into the STEM enrichment programs at a much earlier time;

b)     expanded the paths for information about and application to these programs at critical educational junctures;

c)     broadened participation in Hunter’s STEM enrichment programs;

d)     reinvented the mentoring of students in the programs and their research placements to better integrate research and education; and

e)     assessed program effectiveness and track student progress to inform and improve recruitment and retention into Hunter’s science programs and majors and enhance students’ opportunities once they graduate.

 

We have institutionalized several aspects of this project. These include the undergraduate research website, the research opportunities database, the comprehensive database to track student outcomes, professional development opportunities, and the annual Undergraduate Research Conference.  Some efforts, most notably the general application and the matching quiz, have been dropped, but after careful assessment of the efficacy of these programs, the original UGR team had concluded that few students were finding them useful, so it is likely that they too would have decided to discontinue supporting them, especially given how labor-intensive it is to keep them updated.
